main event: A U.S. Air Force aircraft crew observed a bright white, round object that appeared to be a satellite ascending and descending near their aircraft over the Pacific Ocean.
interesting points: The object moved rapidly at a 45-degree angle, appearing and disappearing in front of the aircraft.
The object was observed for about 5 minutes and was about the size of a BB pellet at arm's length.
Several military radars in the area, including an AEW&C aircraft, a Navy picket vessel, and coastal search radars, did not detect any radar contact with the object.
The observers stated they had previously observed the Echo I satellite on 4-5 occasions and believed this object had the appearance of a satellite in orbit.
The weather conditions were clear above the cloud deck, and the moon had not yet risen during the sighting.
witnesses: Crew of a U.S. Air Force aircraft
photographs: No photographs were included in the report.
